titleStmt.title: A catalogue and succession of the kings, princes, dukes, marquesses, earles, and viscounts of this realme of England, since the Norman Conquest, to this present yeare, 1619 Together, vvith their armes, vviues, and children: the times of their deaths and burials, with many their memorable actions. Collected by Raphe Brooke Esquire, Yorke Herauld: discouering, and reforming many errors committed, by men of other profession, and lately published in print ...
titleStmt.author: Brooke, Ralph, 1553-1625.

titleStmt.title: A catalogue and succession of the kings, princes, dukes, marquesses, earles, and viscounts of this realme of England, since the Norman Conquest, to this present yeare, 1619 Together, vvith their armes, vviues, and children: the times of their deaths and burials, with many their memorable actions. Collected by Raphe Brooke Esquire, Yorke Herauld: discouering, and reforming many errors committed, by men of other profession, and lately published in print ...
titleStmt.author: Brooke, Ralph, 1553-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by VVilliam Iaggard, and sold at his house in Barbican,

notesStmt.note: The "errors" referred to occur in "The history, and lives, of twentie kings of England" by William Martyn and "The catalogue of honor" by Thomas Milles.
The second page following p. 7 is numbered 8.

The four final pages are: [1] contents, [2] "Faults escaped ..", [3] "Errata ..", [4] blank. Variant (earlier): with one errata leaf only. Four final pages are [1] contents, [2] blank, [3] "Errata ..", [4] blank.

Several leaves or quires are known in cancelled and uncancelled states; for details see STC. The pagination above corresponds to the cancelled state of quire A; if uncancelled the pagination is continuous to p. 20.
The shields of the coats of arms are all blank.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
